text: Table | Composition of bone cement Poly(methyl methacrylate) (PMMA) (90%) Powder polymer: pre-polymerized PMMA Initiator: dibenzoylperoxide Liquid monomer (MMA) Activator: N.N-dimethyl-p-toluidine Antibiotics Gentamicin, tobramycin, clindamycin Radiographic contrast material (10%) ~ Zirconium dioxide or barium sulphate Table 2 Potential disadvantages of antibiotic-loaded bone cement Alteration in the mechanical and structural properties of the bone cement Antibiotic resistance Allergic reactions Systemic toxicity Cost implications In general, low-dose antibiotic- loaded bone cement is defined as 1g of powdered antibiotic per 40 g of bone cement. Antibiotic-loaded bone cements have also been implicated as a rare cause of postoperative renal failure in at-risk patients.
